action.action-desc: Mr. Connolly introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Controlled Substances Act to strike the definition of imminent danger to the public health or safety that was added by Public Law 114–145 for purposes of suspending a registration.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Opioid Immediate Suspension Order Act of 2017.

section.header: Definition of imminent danger to the public health or safety for purposes of suspending a registration
section.text: Section 304(d) of the Controlled Substances Act (21 U.S.C. 824(d)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking (d)(1) The Attorney General and inserting (d) The Attorney General; and
